Job description


THE COMPANY



Semi government organisation undergoing unprecedent transformation is a trusted household name. The group is the largest provider of services in its niche across Australia.



THE OPPORTUNITY


A unique opportunity has become available for a talented and passionate technically focussed finance professional to put their heart and soul into the transformation journey as the Financial Controller.


Leading a small but nimble team your key accountabilities will include:

  • Driving the development of strong financial control strategies to meet the group's strategic plan
  • Manage the timely preparation of internal, external and statutory periodic reports and ensure that all accounting standards and legislative requirements are met;
  • Design and implement balance sheet and capital management strategy designed to extract maximum value from the balance sheet
  • Lead negotiation and liaise with external funders on capital projects funding



EXPERIENCE, SKILLS, QUALIFICATIONS



To be successful you will be a CA qualified accounting professional with a keen interest in technical accounting issues. Previous experience within statutory reporting for large and highly complex organisation will be highly favoured. Superior communication skills and a demonstrated track record in leading teams in an environment of tight deadlines are also essential. An understanding of public sector accounting will be highly advantageous.



OCEANS GROUP



Oceans Group is a boutique executive search firm. Trusted and highly valued, with extensive networks, we service a broad spectrum of industries across Finance, Strategy and Consulting, Legal and Company Secretarial, Projects and Transformation, Regulatory and Corporate Governance, Risk Management and Technology.



If you would like to apply for this opportunity, please follow the links or call Vanessa Stack at Oceans Group on 02 9037 1852

NSW State Trainer- La Roche Posay

Company Name L'Or\xe9al Company Location Sydney Central Business District, AU

New Posted Date Posted 13 hours ago Number of views 10 views

Job description

L’Or\xe9al Australia is part of the L’Or\xe9al Group – the world’s largest pure beauty company with over 100 years of history and experience. We are a passionate team in a growing market, working to deliver our mission of Beauty for All through our local portfolio of 25 brands.

L’Or\xe9al was founded by a scientist and we have always focused on cutting-edge research and innovation. Our innovation now also centres around the opportunity that the worldwide digital transformation provides and we are leaders in connecting beauty and technology.

Our business is energetic and vibrant, underpinned by strong ethical principles and our belief that financial performance and responsible business go hand-in-hand. We are driven each day by our six founding values - Passion, Innovation, Entrepreneurial spirit, Open-mindedness, Quest for excellence and Responsibility.

Our Active Cosmetics Division is a pioneer in dermocosemetics and has a team which is passionate about health and beauty. In Australia, the division is growing quickly through its brand La Roche-Posay which is made available to consumers through a multichannel approach. The division also partners with healthcare professionals across the country to add value to consumers through products backed by the power of the Group’s research and innovation.

About The Role

To assist in the growth of our business, we have an exciting opportunity for a State Trainer and Educator to join the La Roche Posay team for our NSW territory. There will be equal travel to both states so flexibility to travel frequently is absolutely crucial for this role. Facilitating education programs at our Head Office as well as training within our current pharmacy customers, you will animate and detail the La Roche Posay brand and products.
  • Visiting new and existing pharmacies to develop education programs for staff
  • Conducting La Roche Posay group education and one-on-one training with existing and new clients
  • Detailing of the La Roche Posay product portfolio to pharmacy staff
  • Managing pharmacy education content and animation to ensure training collateral meets the customer’s needs.


About You
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • A vibrant and engaging personality and a drive to succeed
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Results driven attitude and a passion for educating others

We are seeking a dynamic professional with a love of skincare. You will be an experienced trainer who has a strong knowledge of the pharmacy environment. Previous experience in a similar training role will also be highly regarded. A working knowledge of La Roche Posay is desirable, but not essential requirement for this role.

We are an equal opportunity employer and we encourage applications from people regardless of gender, ethnicity, religious beliefs or disability.

If you would like the opportunity to grow your career within a global, brand focused organisation, please apply.

IA Design is looking for an experienced Accounts Clerk to join our Sydney CBD team.\xa0\xa0

Responsible for the creation and sending of client invoices, as well as overdue accounts collection.\xa0\xa0A large part of the collection process has been automated via our paperless finance system, so the collections role is primarily issue resolution.\xa0 The time split of the roles is approximately 50/50 between the two key tasks.

Network Engineer

Company Name Special Broadcasting Service (SBS) Australia Company Location 14 Herbert Street Artarmon, Sydney, NSW 2064, AU

New Posted Date Posted 11 hours ago Number of views 15 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The SBS technical landscape is constantly evolving, and our industry-leading platforms need a hand to stay connected and ahead of the curve. This Network Engineer role is responsible for the implementation, development, documentation, testing, and maintenance of LAN and WAN networks, routers, switches and firewall solutions. Working independently, in a team, and with vendors; the role is expected to innovate and ensure quality is constantly improving, ensure the integrity of data transmission, implementation and support meet both industry best practice and SBS requirements.


The successful candidate will possess knowledge and experience in the following:


  • Cisco Catalyst based Network Switches and routers
  • Cisco Wireless Access Points
  • Cisco Prime and Cisco DCNM management
  • Cisco Checkpoint, ASA 5000 series firewalls, ASR 1000 routers
  • BGP, RIP routing protocols
  • Multicasting
  • Familiarity with SDN & SDDC technologies and their applications
  • Experience with Nexus 9K and VXLAN
  • Experience in developing, maintaining and delivering to a project timeline or delivery schedule
  • Knowledge or experience of the Broadcast/Production sector


Really, we're after someone with strong fundamentals. If you understand modern networking environments intimately, but don't necessarily have a strict vendor alignment (you've used Juniper rather than Cisco etc) then we would still like to discuss this opportunity.


On offer is a very healthy remuneration package, agile and flexible work spaces and arrangements (stand-up desks, meeting pods, solo spaces dedicated to quiet reflection and work) and onsite health & well-being programmes. We want you to love your place of work, so not only are you part of an organisation focused on making a positive social difference, but there's also free onsite parking (subject to availability), onsite childcare facilities, free gym membership, and an active social club.


SBS believe that professional growth is a fundamental necessity for people to be engaged and happy. We are heavily investing to continually improve our Learning & Development capabilities across the organisation, particularly developing leadership capabilities. We are dedicated to helping our people grow, not just our organisation.


If the above sounds like your thing, we'd love to discuss your work and tell you more about our side of things too. Send through a resume and we can arrange a time to have a chat and see how things fare.


At SBS we pride ourselves on harbouring a flexible and inclusive environment for everyone. To ensure this doesn't change, we recruit with this in mind.


****NO AGENCIES PLEASE****

Job description

Open to full-time or part-time (3-4 days per week) candidates


About the role
In this role, the Corporate Solutions Manager will identify opportunities within large corporate's and position the suite of AMP Corporate Superannuation products as an appropriate solution to ensure success in new corporate sales, through tenders from consulting houses.


You will develop and execute a New Business Plan in respect of the sale of new corporate super plans through the AMP product set.


Duties


  • Develop an appropriate New Business Plan for Corporate Superannuation, encompassing new business and key sales related metrics
  • Create and maintain strong business relationships and an appropriate level of interaction with key industry consultants and appropriate personnel within large corporates
  • Promote the awareness of the AMP Corporate Superannuation value proposition and position this as the pre-eminent option in all opportunities
  • Co-ordinate corporate superannuation offers for clients including advice on taxation/legislation, benefit design, investments, insurance and communications
  • Maintain strong relationships with consulting houses to identify growth opportunities.
  • Maintain strong relationships within AMP Corporate Superannuation and the broader AMP to support a total ‘solution’ approach for client’s needs, and to identify growth opportunities.

Skills & experience


  • Experience in developing and delivering formal business presentations and written communications with large corporate clients (ASX 200)
  • Demonstrate experience or significant exposure in B2B sales processes and environment
  • Experience in sales of corporate superannuation products
  • Deep knowledge of current and proposed superannuation legislation and industry trends
  • Tertiary qualification in a business discipline or accreditation in ASFA Superannuation Diploma or currently studying towards completion, or can demonstrate equivalent relevant experience

Working for AMP


Working for AMP means being part of a company that values diverse thinking, encourages collaboration and promotes innovation. \xa0It’s an environment that offers challenging and exciting work as well as opportunities for professional growth. We’re flexible enough to allow you to make the most of your life, both professionally and personally.


We are looking for those that have the courage and agility to navigate changing and complex environments so that we can deliver the best solutions for our customers. We value people with integrity, an innate willingness to help others and an eagerness to perform to the best of their abilities.\xa0


We’re transforming our business, and we need people like you to join us on this journey.


Wellbeing & Benefits


As a company that values wellbeing, we offer a range of great benefits to support you financially, professionally and personally. These include access to a wide range of flexible working options including the ability to purchase extra leave, retail discounts, onsite wellbeing centre including a gym (Sydney Office), Employee Assistance Program, competitive home loan rates, leading superannuation contribution, discounted financial advice and personal insurance.


Inclusion & Diversity


AMP recognises individual differences and welcomes people from a variety of life and work experiences. The diversity of our people is core to our ability to innovate, grow and to fulfill our collective aspiration of helping people to own their tomorrow. A natural curiosity, a respect for differences and a growth mindset are valued at AMP.

The team at Caltex love keeping you and the rest of Australia moving. Whether you're travelling to and from work, home or school, or heading out to the park, brunch or the footy, we're with you all the way.



Our familiarity with our customers drives us to deliver a standard of service that is second to none. To help us do this, we're looking for a Store Manager to join our team at Yass, NSW! As the leader of the Calstores store team, you'll make sure our customers keep coming back for more. You'll do this by supporting your team to deliver on operational excellence and providing the best in customer service.



You'll be responsible for:

  • Building and developing the store team
  • Maintaining excellent store presentation through visual merchandising, inventory management and stock control
  • Managing the accuracy and security of all store transactions
  • Driving store profitability through operational excellence and loss prevention
  • Implementing operational policies and manage back office administration




To do this job well, you'll be a people person who loves making an impression. You've got energy and can motivate and give clear direction to your team. You work fast and notice the little things that make all the difference and will be committed to working to Caltex's high safety standards. You will have exceptional people skills along with proven experience in leading a team.



We will make sure we look after you too with competitive pay including allowances and incentives, quality training and real career progression opportunities.

Get your career in motion with Caltex and apply now or visit our Careers website at https://jobs.caltex.com.au/.



Caltex operates 24 hours a day, 365 days a year so flexibility is a must for successful applicants.

Contact the job poster

Kathryn Jobson

Talent Acquisition Advisor at Caltex Australia

Sydney, Australia

  • Retail

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

Project Manager Property

New Posted Date Posted 12 hours ago Number of views 25 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Help Sydney Water to shape the lifestyle of greater Sydney
  • Design, plan and deliver projects across the Sydney Water Property portfolio
  • Parramatta head office location


About us

Our Financial Service Group is creating a capability uplift both within our Procurement / Supply Chain teams and across the wider organisation which will seek to increase our ability to deliver standardised and simplified process, leverage knowledge and expertise within the organisation, provide deep insights to enable the business to make more informed decisions while providing expertise in specific business areas that create business value.


About the role

The Project Manager Property will be responsible for the designing, planning and delivery of projects across the Sydney Water Property Portfolio as required by provisional and capital programs and identified by property and asset condition assessments.

This role reports to the Property and Asset Manager and, you will be required to partner with general managers, heads of businesses and other stakeholders across Sydney Water to ensure that property management objective are achieved.


Within this leadership focused position, you will:


  • Oversee programs, issue instructions, manage tasks and modular components of projects (at all levels of risk/complexity) from project initiation to close out.
  • Develop, manage and update Project Management Plans (PMP) with clear targets, objectives, KPl's, scope of work, milestones, risks, controls, costs and deliverables which meet the business needs and ensure the effective delivery of the project.
  • Ensure business case and contract variations are identified, registered, validated, tracked and approved.
  • Report on project status including KPl's, cost, schedule, risk and any variations.
  • Ensure plans and resources can organise and control conflicting priorities between projects.
  • Ensure Quality, WHS and Environmental plans are developed, reviewed, approved and monitored to ensure compliance to contract and SWC Management plans
  • Ensure Industrial Relations (IR) risk is known and mitigated and ensures the project / contractor IR Plan is approved and adhered to.
  • Ensure pre-start meetings are held with Service Providers/Contractors, including activity and work- based pre-planning.
  • Ensure Post Implementation Reviews are conducted for all projects, outcomes are documented and lessons learned are shared within Group Property.


As a successful applicant, you will have:


  • Relevant degree qualification (e.g. property, project management, engineering, architecture) or experience deemed equivalent
  • Demonstrated experience in managing the delivery of multi-disciplinary infrastructure projects
  • Experience in managing various forms of commercial arrangements, dealing with local and other government authorities to drive ‘value for money’ outcomes
  • Demonstrates proficiency in identifying and managing avoidable property risks including reputational risk triggers, resolves issues; monitor and reports progress
  • Engages with contractors and consultants on day to day basis
  • Has sound working knowledge of relevant information databases, systems and processes
  • Collaborates with team members in Property, Strategic Property Development Engineering, Legal, HR and other related functions to deliver effective land management and facilities management
  • Prepare clear project proposals and define scope and goals in measurable terms
  • Prepare accurate estimates of costs and resources required for more complex projects
  • Communicate the project strategy and its expected benefits to others
  • Monitor the completion of project milestones against goals and initiate amendments.


Please refer to the Position Description on our Career Site for further details.


We want your perspective and ideas to help us find better ways to delight our customers, so we encourage you to apply no matter your age, sex or culture. You can be part of a committed, highly skilled team who’ll appreciate what you bring to the table.


You’ll set and achieve real goals and make decisions that matter, as together we help shape the lifestyle of greater Sydney.


As part of the application process, Sydney Water will be collecting your personal information to assess your suitability for the role. We will also use your personal information to establish a LiveHire talent profile in our Talent Community. We look at our Talent Community first when new opportunities come up when you apply for a role. Your personal information will be collected in accordance with LiveHire’s Terms, Privacy Policy and Sydney Water’s Privacy Collection Statement – Job Application

About NCR
NCR Corporation (NYSE: NCR) is the global leader in consumer transaction technologies, turning everyday interactions with businesses into exceptional experiences. With its software, hardware, and portfolio of services, NCR enables nearly 700 million transactions daily across retail, financial, travel, hospitality, telecom and technology, and small business. NCR solutions run the everyday transactions that make your life easier. NCR is headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, with nearly 30,000 employees and does business in 180 countries.



Responsibilities

  • Investigates assigned problems through to resolution or error identification
  • Coordinates actions of others as necessary to assist with analysis and resolution actions for problems and Known Errors
  • Monitors progress on the resolution of Known Errors and advises 2nd Level support staff on the best available Work-Around for Incidents related to unresolved Problems/Known Errors
  • Assists with the handling of major Incidents and identifying the root
  • Create problem records and perform root cause analysis
  • Escalates issues for resolution, to avoid reoccurrence or close problem
  • Provide pro-active trend analysis
  • Facilitating and coordinating technical meetings.
  • Leading and facilitating post mortem investigations into high impact faults
  • Provides 24x7 L3 support to the Team as SME based on rotational roster
  • Attend critical incident meetings during active incidents and represent the team, show technical leadership

Accountabilities

Process

  • Adhere to NCR Policies and Methodologies and those of the customer (if working on site)
  • Use ITIL Best Practice methods as per the customer process
  • In depth understanding of the NCRIT systems, environment and development paths as well as those of our clients

  • Complete other related tasks as required by key stakeholders



Skills

Technical - Obligatory Skills

  • Knowledge of Windows Server operating system architecture and security
  • Understanding of Microsoft applications
  • Understanding technical specifications
  • Analysis of business requirements
  • Testing: Developing test plans, Writing test scripts and System testing to ensure that delivered software is reliable and satisfies the business requirements
  • Scripting skills in Kix, VB, SQL DB, SQL Queries
  • Understanding of customer’s IT systems
  • Strong problem analysis skills
  • Knowledge of internet protocols such as SSH, FTP, SFTP & HTTP, as well as the ability to use diagnostic tools such as trace route, ping.

  • Preferable to have experience with R10 Product.
  • Experience with Virtual server technology


Competencies

  • Problem-solving skills with an emphasis on resolution of complex technical problems
  • Excellent analytical and trend analysis skills.
  • Have innovative, technical and creative approach
  • Ability to effectively mentor junior team members and to contribute to team key performance indicators
  • Ability to handle multiple tasks
  • Excellent verbal and written communication
  • Excellent time management skills
  • Willingness to undertake training as required and apply knowledge to improve IT
  • Passion, drive and ‘can do’ attitude

  • Achievement focused
  • Ability to build relationships
  • Highly developed communication skills
  • Ability to work in a team environment as well as independently
  • Ability to provide courteous, professional, and efficient service to company clientele
  • Customer service orientated

  • Available to work in 24x7 rotating support roster



Experience

  • Experience with performing and coordinating RCA and trend analysis
  • Experience in high tech customer support and in on-job support at customer sites – an advantage
  • Retail systems



Obligatory

  • Ability to work standby shifts (including weekends and holidays)

Education

Statement to Third Party Agencies

About Us

Western Health manages three acute public hospitals: Footscray, Sunshine and Williamstown Hospital. It also operates the Sunbury Day Hospital, Transition Care at Hazeldean and a range of community based services. We care for a culturally diverse population of more than 800,000 people. We have more than 6,700 employees who are driven by our values of ‘Compassion, Accountability, Respect, Excellence and Safety’ (CARES).

Our continued growth will see the completion of a new purpose built, multi-storey Joan Kirner Women's and Children's Hospital.

About The Role

If you are an experienced highly motivated Renal Nurse Educator we need you to join the Renal Team at Western Health.

You would be responsible for the development, coordination, implementation and evaluation of training and education programmes which support the renal services across the dialysis units, home therapies unit and inpatient wards. Your input is also integral in supporting graduate nurses to transition to practice in dialysis so you must be able to travel across all four Western Health Hospitals.

You would also be required to contribute to and / or develop and review all renal policies and procedures.

Culture

Senior Technical Business Analyst - Fixed-Term

Company Name Jetstar Airways Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 59 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Fixed-term role (until 30th June 2019)
    • Jetstar thrives on innovation! We are always looking to employ ambitious and proactive professionals to help our business work smarter and more efficiently. You will be encouraged to think innovatively whilst developing and maintaining best practice. What’s more, this role will see you working as part of a broader group Jetstar and Qantas structure.

    Day in and day out at Jetstar our teams across Asia Pacific searching for new ways to make the world more accessible. New places to fly, new ways to add value and new ideas to improve performance. At Jetstar your contribution has the potential to advance the business as the clear customer choice for value travel.

    It’s an exciting time to be part of Digital at Jetstar! We have a large portfolio of work to improve the way we service our customers. We want to ensure that we continue to have leading Digital channels, and that we are using data to provide the right product to our customers in the right channel and at the right time.

    One Strategic Initiative We Are Current Focused On Is To Introduce a Better ‘services’ Architecture By Using APIs And Microservices To
    • Enable easier integration of new systems and solutions
    • Enable faster innovation and delivery of business goals and objectives
    • Centralise business rules to reduce maintenance
    • Promote reuse of software and hence reduce effort to introduce new channels and functionality
    We are currently seeking a highly capable Senior Technical Business Analyst to join our Melbourne or Singapore based Office team. Focusing on achieving our services architecture by working with stakeholders across Jetstar and with the development team.

    Your Main Accountabilities Will Be To
    • Perform Business Analysis by select and using effective approaches and techniques/models to envisage, elicit, analyse, model and communicate features
    • Develop, prioritise and manage the API Services backlog by working with the Product Owner, API team and other stakeholders
    • Decompose an initiative into epics and stories
    • Produce service specifications and other documentation to support agile delivery and ongoing support of API and microservices
    • Facilitate discussions with stakeholders to drive the definition of an initiative's objectives and requirements
    • Work collaboratively with Jetstar stakeholders to identify a minimum viable product, balancing functional, architectural & user experience considerations
    • Drive the definition of quality of service (non-functional) requirements
    • Work with your team to drive improvement in delivery efficiency
    To be successful in these roles, you will demonstrate the following skills & experience:
    • Strong experience working as a Business Analyst in an Agile environment, with experience across a range of BA approaches and techniques
    • Technical background, ideally with experience defining API Services
    • Experience with Swagger and Postman (or similar tools)
    • Experience in Digital
    • Experience working with Agile, in particularly Scrum
    • Strong stakeholder management and communications skills, and the ability to interact with all levels of the organisation
    • Travel Industry experience a bonus
    • Willingness to travel from time to time 
    About Us

    The Jetstar Group has airlines in Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, Japan and Vietnam. Since launch in 2004, we have grown from a team of 700 to 7,600 and have flown more than 250 million passengers. Collectively we now offer more than 5000 flights a week to more than 85 destinations in 17 countries and territories across the Asia Pacific region, with a fleet of more than 130 aircraft.

    Our Culture
    Jetstar is alive with a sense of adventure. Day in and day out, our teams search for new places to fly, new ways to add value and new ideas to improve performance. If you love the road less travelled, you’ll love working here because ours is a team who innovate every day, thrive on delivery, support each other and celebrate our successes. You’ll be supported to challenge, anticipate and explore while you work will connect people and enrich lives. We encourage diversity and aim to create an environment where our employees feel valued, respected and enabled.

    Our Benefits
    Team members have access to heavily discounted fares to destinations all over the world – not only for team members, but for their favourite travel companions too. Our staff travel benefit includes discounts on airfares, accommodation, car hire and travel insurance for both domestic and international travel. Discounts can be used within the Jetstar Group airlines, Qantas and other partner airlines.

913047205:
[

Senior IT Change Manager - Fixed Term / Kogarah

Company Name Westpac Group Company Location Kogarah, AU

New Posted Date Posted 4 hours ago Number of views 5 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Westpac aims to be the leading financial services company in Australia and we are looking for people who have the drive and commitment to build the leading financial services company in their community.

In turn, we offer a great work environment where you'll feel respected and valued. You'll be rewarded with a competitive salary and benefits package and the satisfaction of working with Westpac - helping us help customers better than ever before.

Our customer base is diverse and so are the people who work at Westpac, so people from all walks of life are encouraged to apply. Your attitude and passion are as important to us as your experience.

Why has this role been created?



  • The Organisational Change Program has been established to develop ‘platform as a service’ cloud, and adapt our workforce to new technologies and capabilities, with an emphasis on managing composite services (as opposed to bespoke technology solutions).
  • The Program will introduce a scalable integrated service delivery model and drive a customer service excellence focus in all elements of Infrastructure and Operations daily work



What will you be doing?





  • The Senior Change Manager is responsible for defining and delivering specific domain stream/s of a future state operating model for Infrastructure & Operations supported by a comprehensive change and HR program.
  • The role will work closely with the Program Change Lead, key stakeholders, project streams, process and operating model owners and Business Service Managers, to ensure I&O customers are ready, willing and able, to consume end-to-end services provided by Infrastructure and Operations, and our teams are ready, willing and able to provide them.





What Skills and experience are we looking for?

  • Five to ten years’ experience delivering organisation change in a corporate and/or matrix environment
  • Five + years’ experience managing senior stakeholders, vendors, finances and delivering to project management methodologies
  • Knowledge and proven track record in managing end-to-end technology directed change, including in a multi supplier environment, and particularly in relation to changes to technology infrastructure operating models will be well regarded.
  • Track record of successfully overseeing change including:
  • Commercial acumen
  • Risk management and governance
  • Educating and influencing
  • Knowledge of necessary methodologies, tools and processes
  • Up to date knowledge of relevant financial regulatory and legal requirements
  • ServiceNow implementation experience desirable
  • Financial services industry experience desirable
  • Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills
  • Proven capability in people management





We offer a competitive salary, benefits, and a stimulating team environment. Your attitude and passion are as important to us as your experience.

Westpac is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from men and women of all ages, including people with a disability and indigenous Australians.

To express your interest, please follow the online prompts to apply directly online.

Westpac Group is an equal opportunity employer. As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility.

  • Salary Packaging is offered with this position
  • Opportunities for professional development

About Us:


At Anglicare Victoria our focus is on transforming the futures of children and young people, families and adults. Our work is based on three guiding pillars, Prevent, Protect, Empower. We offer a comprehensive network of services and seek to ensure the provision of high quality services that will bring about significant improvements in the life experience of the young people, children and families/caregivers with whom we work.


The Position:


In this role you will work collaboratively with clients to identify support that meets their recovery needs, and coordinate this support. The Support Facilitator will also play a key role in finding creative resources and solutions to assist the client in their goals to recovery.\xa0 The Support Facilitator will assist eligible client’s access the NDIS and provide support coordination for clients who transition to the NDIS.


To Be Successful in this Position You Will Need:\xa0


  • A relevant tertiary qualification in Social Work, Psychology, Early Childhood Specialist and/or related behavioural sciences at degree level with substantial experience
  • Experience working collaboratively with multiple stakeholders in formal and informal partnerships to achieve intended goals with a range of age, gender and cultural groups.
  • A demonstrated knowledge and understanding of the issues and impacts faced by those with experience of mental illness, psychosocial disability and other disabilities.
  • Well-developed communication skills, including written communication and computer literacy, and the capacity to fulfil reporting requirements of the program.
  • Well-developed understanding of Support Coordination within NDIS.

Please Note: It is mandatory for the successful applicant to hold a current Working with Children Check and be prepared to undergo a National Criminal History Check prior to commencement.


Detailed Position Description\xa0\xa0PD - Partners in Recovery Support Facilitator - Swan Hill - September 2018.pdf


To apply for this position you will need to complete the online application. You will be requested to attach your resume and your responses to the Key Selection Criteria as separate documents.


For further enquiries contact\xa0\xa0Marlene\xa0Lamprell, Program Manager Mental Health and Disability Services on\xa003 5440 1100.


Applications close Friday 19 October 2018.


We encourage and welcome applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People.
